Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2019 10:40AM kimberly62 wrote: I have been on Evista for about a year now, you must be postmenopausal to be on this drug. I haven't had any side effects that I can tell, and this drug has the bonus of being bone strengthening. I had a bone scan last year and had osteopenia, so having something to help strengthen my bones was a plus for me. Good luck with your decisions, it is all so very confusing at times. This is the 3rd one I have tried, so far, so good!
Posts.Title: Evista and side effects for ADH and ALH lululinks kimberly62

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2019 04:09AM kimberly62 wrote: Lululinks, you might want to post some of these questions on the hormonal therapy board, more people may respond.
Posts.Title: Evista and side effects for ADH and ALH lululinks kimberly62

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2018 08:16PM kimberly62 wrote: Hi Lakegirl, I have been on Evista for about 9 months and have done just fine. I was previously on Tamoxifen, then my Doctor switched me to Exemestane after menopause which caused all sorts of side effects. I have been pleasantly surprised with Evista, and it's not hard on your bones like aromatase inhibitors are.
